column1: Which of the following policy areas, if any, do you think should be the main priorities for London? Please rank your top three
Making walking and cycling safer and easier
A real push to tackle homelessness
Strengthening relationships between Londoners from different backgrounds
Making London safer for women and girls
Protecting jobs, supporting new skills and development opportunities
Making London's arts and culture the best in the world
Making London a truly 24 hour city
Tackling crime and making London safer
Supporting businesses and promoting economic growth in London
Tackling the climate emergency and improving the environment
And which of the following policy areas, if any, do you think Sadiq Khan, the Mayor of London, is prioritising at the moment? Please rank your top three
Making walking and cycling safer and easier
A real push to tackle homelessness
Strengthening relationships between Londoners from different backgrounds
Making London safer for women and girls
Protecting jobs, supporting new skills and development opportunities
Making London's arts and culture the best in the world
Making London a truly 24 hour city
Tackling crime and making London safer
Supporting businesses and promoting economic growth in London
Tackling the climate emergency and improving the environment
Thinking about your current financial situation, which of these statements best applies to you?
I am having to go without my basic needs and/or rely on debt to pay for my basic needs
I'm struggling to make ends meet
Thinking about the last six months, have you, or have you not, been able to meet payments on the following?
I've fallen behind on all payments
I fell behind on one or more payments
I kept up with payments, but struggled every time
I kept up with payments, but it was a struggle to do so at least once
I kept up with payments without any difficulties

I've fallen behind on all payments

I kept up with payments, but struggled every time
I kept up with payments, but it was a struggle to do so at least once
I kept up with payments without any difficulties
Thinking about the last six months, which of the following statements describes you?
I have had to buy less food or essential items, go without or rely on outside support (food parcels from a food bank for example) regularly
I have had to buy less food or essential items than I needed, go without or rely on outside support (food parcels from a food bank for example) on some occasions
I have been able to buy the food and essential items I needed, but struggled every time
I have been able to buy the food and essential items I needed, but struggled to do so at least once
I have been able to buy the food and essential items I needed without any difficulties
To what extent have each of the following living costs increased, decreased or stayed the same for your household over the last six months?
Regular household shop (for food and essential items)
Overall, for your household, has the cost of living increased, decreased or stayed the same over the last six months?
Which, if any, of the following are you doing to help manage living costs? Please tick all that apply.  Reducing costs
I am buying less food and essentials
I am using less water, energy or fuel
I am shopping around more or switching providers
I am spending less on non-essentials Removing costs
I am using free transport (walking or cycling)
I am going without essentials (food, electricity or gas for example)
I am stopping or delaying spend on non-essentials Credit or monetary solutions
I am borrowing money from friends or family
I am using more credit or going into debt (including overdrafts, loans, credit or store cards or missing payments) Increasing income
I am looking for a better-paying job
I am negotiating a higher wage
I am working more paid hours in existing jobs
I am taking on additional paid work elsewhere
I have reviewed the state benefits I'm entitled to
I am claiming a wider range of state benefits than I was before
I am now claiming state benefits, when I wasn't before
I have started in paid employment Other

From May 2024, a requirement to show photo ID in order to vote in elections will be in place across Great Britain.  This includes UK Parliamentary elections, London Mayor and London Assembly elections. Before taking this survey, were you aware of this?
Yes – I was aware of this, and know which forms of photo ID will be accepted
Yes – I was aware this, but do not know which forms of photo ID will be accepted
No – I was not aware of this
Which, if any, of the following forms of ID do you currently hold? Please select all that apply.
Proof of Age Standards Scheme (PASS) identity card
Concessionary travel pass e.g. Oyster 60+ card or Freedom Pass

A 'Voter Authority Certificate' can now be used to vote in person in elections and referendums in Great Britain as a form of accepted Voter ID. Before taking this survey, had you heard of a 'Voter Authority Certificate'?
Yes, I had heard of this
No, I had not heard of this
Before taking this survey, were you, or were you not aware of the following changes to voting in Great Britain that will be coming into force in October 2023?
Eligible voters will be able to apply online for postal voting and will need to renew their postal voting applications every three years
Yes, I was aware of this
No, I was not aware of this
Eligible voters will be able to apply online for proxy voting and will only be able to act as a proxy for up to four people (of whom only two can be domestic electors)
Yes, I was aware of this
No, I was not aware of this
By 'electoral register' we mean the official list of people entitled to vote.As far as you are aware, is your name on the electoral register for where you are living now or another address?
Yes,  my name IS on the electoral register for where I'm living now
Yes, my name IS on the electoral register for another address
No, my name IS NOT on the electoral register

Above are some images from the Greater London Authority and Shout Out UK's $HashNoVoice campaign to increase awareness of voter ID requirements. Before taking this survey, had you seen or heard anything about this campaign?
Yes, I have seen or heard something about this campaign
No, I have not seen or heard anything about this campaign
And through which, if any of the follow channels did you see or hear something about the Greater London Authority and Shout Out UK's $HashNoVoice campaign? Please select all that apply.
Print newspapers and magazines, including in community languages
https://registertovote.london/ , the Greater London Authority Democracy Hub website

column2: All figures, unless otherwise stated, are from YouGov Plc.  Total sample size was 1546 adults. Fieldwork was undertaken between 10th - 16th November 2023.
The survey was carried out online. The figures have been weighted and are representative of all London adults (aged 18+).
